The experimental values of the bulk moduli (
B 0
) increase inside the fourth row from MnSi to CoSi [ 68]. DFT calculations cannot grasp this trend. For MnSi, FeSi, and CoSi, the calculated moduli were almost the same. Only a marginal decrease of
B 0
was obtained for MnSi when allowing for a magnetic ground state. In general, the theoretical overestimation of the bulk moduli for MnSi, FeSi, and CoSi correlates with the underestimation of the lattice constants compared to the experimental values. The best agreement was found for CoSi, for which error in
a 0
was 0.3%, and in
B 0
was 6%.
